instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00244: What is 820-00244? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.3V3_S0SW_LCD: What is 3V3_S0SW_LCD? 3V3_S0SW_LCD is a 3.3v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state that powers the LCD screen image circuitry. This is necessary to get an image on the screen.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No LCD or external after liquid damage
threads.message:
Got this with liquid damage around U817, <CHIP>U8250</CHIP> as well as on the soundboard. 

After cleaning I have a steady 1.5/1.8 and 3.3V in that area. Chips seem to be working. 

I cannot get the LCD or external monitor to work. With both LCD connected and disconnected there is no signal via USB-C HDMI. 

Macbook turns on and chimes and I have a response from the Capslock key. I have tried PRAM reset.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No LCD or external after liquid damage
threads.message:
Do you get 3V3/<SIGNAL>5V_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL>, at least when chimes?
<SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> should go high at same time.
Check with internal LCD connected, of course...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No LCD or external after liquid damage
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No LCD or external after liquid damage
threads.message:
That means CPU detected internal LCD.
Check diode mode to ground on all <SIGNAL>DP_INT</SIGNAL> lines of J8500.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No LCD or external after liquid damage
threads.message:
I assume this is with disconnected screen?

[ATTACH type="full"]60646[/ATTACH]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No LCD or external after liquid damage
threads.message: Is OK without LCD, if you know the screen is good!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No LCD or external after liquid damage
threads.message:
Well had liquid damage. And I don't have a spare one to test. But with a disconnected screen and turning on the machine I would have thought I will get something on the USBc HDMI output

Unless I get a spare LCD to test seems like I'm at a dead-end
